author: wsjcom
title: Five Best: Jake Tapper
text:
McCarthy By Jack Anderson & Ronald W. May (1952)
1. This spectacular biography was published in 1952, two years before the Senate censured the Communist-hunting senator. Jack Anderson and Ronald W. May paint a vivid portrait of a man driven by a lust for power who had himself cozied up to Communists during his first Senate race. It’s a story that includes Joseph McCarthy’s apparent dependence on intelligence gleaned from a Communist spy when launching his 1949 attack on U.S. Army interrogators of Nazi war criminals—a...
